specifications.Finish: Mechanical > Brushed (front) Brushed is a finishing process that gently raises the surface fibers of the fabric using brushes. This treatment causes the fibers to stand up, creating a soft texture. As a result, the fabric surface becomes fuzzy, providing a warm and soft feel. The brushed surface traps air to reduce heat loss, making it ideal for fall and winter. Chemical > Enzyme Enzymes treatment offers a remarkably soft hand-feel by gently breaking down the fibers’ surface, resulting in a smoother and cleaner texture. This treatment also reduces pilling and fuzz, enhancing the fabric’s durability and maintaining a clean appearance
specifications.Dye Method: Pigment Dye Pigment dye applies color to the fabric surface without penetrating the fibers, creating a vintage, faded look. It offers a soft, unique appearance but may fade more easily with washing.
specifications.Care Advice: Chemical > Enzyme Piece printing on enzyme/bio-washed fabric can cause staining. Therefore, please refrain from piece printing on this fabric. Dye Method > Pigment Dye Pigment dyed fabrics are intended to fade and alter in color gradually over time. so it requires special care in handling.
specifications.Care Instructions: Machine wash cold / Gentle Wash separately Turn inside out before washing, Do not rub Do not bleach Line dry Do not iron Recommended Use Jeans, Outer, Cargo Pants
